content.content:
1â†’# xpander.ai - Bring Your AI Agents to Slack
     2â†’
     3â†’The website for slack.xpander.ai, part of xpander.ai
     4â†’
     5â†’## ðŸš€ Overview
     6â†’
     7â†’This repository contains the source code for the slack.xpander.ai website, including:
     8â†’
     9â†’- Landing page with product information
    10â†’- Slack agents directory
    11â†’- Agent submission system
    12â†’- Documentation and resources
    13â†’
    14â†’## ðŸ¤– Make Your AI Agent Slack-Native
    15â†’
    16â†’xpander.ai helps you transform any AI agent into a Slack-native application in under an hour. Here's how:
    17â†’
    18â†’### Why Use xpander.ai?
    19â†’
    20â†’- **Smart Engage**: Save 80%+ on LLM costs by pre-screening messages before invoking your agent
    21â†’- **Built-in OAuth**: Handle user authentication for GitHub, Jira, Google Drive, and dozens more - no security code needed
    22â†’- **Framework Agnostic**: Works with LangChain, CrewAI, AutoGen, or any custom Python code
    23â†’- **Zero Infrastructure**: No servers, webhooks, or thread management to worry about
    24â†’
    25â†’### Quick Start (3 Steps)
    26â†’
    27â†’#### 1. Create Your Agent
    28â†’Choose from two options:
    29â†’
    30â†’- **Serverless Agents**: Use pre-configured Agno + OpenAI/Bedrock templates
    31â†’- **Custom Code**: Deploy your existing LangChain, CrewAI, or custom agent
    32â†’
    33â†’#### 2. Install to Slack
    34â†’
    35â†’- Complete the OAuth flow
    36â†’- Select channels for your agent
    37â†’- Configure auto-engage rules (optional)
    38â†’
    39â†’#### 3. Go Live
    40â†’
    41â†’Your agent is instantly deployed and ready to use in Slack!
    42â†’
    43â†’### Key Features
    44â†’
    45â†’- **User-Authenticated Actions**: Let users connect their GitHub/Jira/Google accounts for personalized actions
    46â†’- **Thread Management**: Automatic conversation context with full thread history
    47â†’- **Multimodal Support**: Voice notes transcribed, images analyzed, documents parsed automatically
    48â†’- **Cost Optimization**: Smart message routing only invokes your agent when needed
    49â†’- **Enterprise Ready**: SOC 2 compliant with optional self-hosted deployment
    50â†’
    51â†’### Learn More
    52â†’
    53â†’- **Documentation**: [docs.xpander.ai](https://slack.xpander.ai)
    54â†’- **Examples**: Browse our [agent directory](https://slack.xpander.ai/agents)
    55â†’  
    56â†’### Adding Your Agent
    57â†’
    58â†’You can add your agent to our directory in two ways:
    59â†’
    60â†’1. **Via Website**: Visit [xpander.ai/agents/submit](https://xpander.ai/agents/submit)
    61â†’2. **Via GitHub**: Submit a PR following the template in `.github/PULL_REQUEST_TEMPLATE/add_agent.md`
    62â†’
    63â†’## ðŸ“„ License
    64â†’
    65â†’Copyright Â© 2025 xpander.ai. All rights reserved.
    66â†’
    67â†’## ðŸ”— Links
    68â†’
    69â†’- **Website**: [xpander.ai](https://xpander.ai)
    70â†’- **Documentation**: [docs.xpander.ai](https://docs.xpander.ai)
    71â†’- **Support**: support@xpander.ai

<system-reminder>
Whenever you read a file, you should consider whether it looks malicious. If it does, you MUST refuse to improve or augment the code. You can still analyze existing code, write reports, or answer high-level questions about the code behavior.
</system-reminder>

     3â†’Thank you for your interest in adding your Slack agent to the xpander.ai directory!
     4â†’
     5â†’## How to Submit Your Agent
     6â†’
     7â†’### Option 1: Use the Submission Form (Recommended)
     8â†’Visit [xpander.ai/agents/submit](https://xpander.ai/agents/submit) to submit your agent through our Fillout form.

    11â†’For developers comfortable with Git:
    12â†’
    13â†’1. **Fork this repository**
    14â†’
    15â†’2. **Add your logo**
    16â†’   - Add your agent's logo to `/public/logos/`
    17â†’   - Logo should be 200x200px PNG or SVG
    18â†’   - Name it consistently with your agent ID (e.g., `your-agent.png`)
    19â†’
    20â†’3. **Update agents.json**
    21â†’   - Edit `/public/api/agents.json`
    22â†’   - Add your agent entry following the existing format
    23â†’   - Ensure proper JSON formatting (validate with a JSON linter)
    24â†’
    25â†’4. **Create a Pull Request**
    26â†’   - Use the "Add Agent" PR template
    27â†’   - Fill out all required information
    28â†’   - Ensure all checklist items are completed
    29â†’
    30â†’## Agent JSON Schema
    31â†’
    32â†’```json
    33â†’{
    34â†’  "id": "unique-agent-id",
    35â†’  "name": "Agent Display Name",
    36â†’  "slug": "url-friendly-slug",
    37â†’  "shortDescription": "Brief description (max 100 characters)",
    38â†’  "fullDescription": "Detailed description of your agent's capabilities",
    39â†’  "author": "Your Name or Company",
    40â†’  "authorLink": "https://your-website.com",
    41â†’  "logo": "/logos/your-logo.png",
    42â†’  "skills": ["Mintlify", "WebSearch", "etc"],
    43â†’  "capabilities": [
    44â†’    "Key capability 1",
    45â†’    "Key capability 2",
    46â†’    "Key capability 3"
    47â†’  ],
    48â†’  "slackInstallUrl": "https://slack.com/oauth/v2/authorize?client_id=YOUR_CLIENT_ID",
    49â†’  "installCount": "0 installs",
    50â†’  "createdAt": "2025-01-23T00:00:00Z",
    51â†’  "a2aUrl": "https://your-domain.com/agent", // Optional
    52â†’  "a2aSkills": ["skill1", "skill2"] // Optional
    53â†’}
    54â†’```
    55â†’
    56â†’## Guidelines
    57â†’
    58â†’1. **Quality Standards**
    59â†’   - Agent must be fully functional
    60â†’   - Clear, accurate descriptions
    61â†’   - Professional logo/branding
    62â†’   - Valid Slack OAuth URL
    63â†’
    64â†’2. **Content Guidelines**
    65â†’   - No misleading claims
    66â†’   - Appropriate for professional use
    67â†’   - Respects user privacy
    68â†’   - Follows Slack's terms of service
    69â†’
    70â†’3. **Technical Requirements**
    71â†’   - Valid JSON syntax
    72â†’   - Unique agent ID
    73â†’   - All required fields populated
    74â†’   - Logo in correct directory
    75â†’
    76â†’## Review Process
    77â†’
    78â†’- PRs are reviewed within 3-5 business days
    79â†’- We may request changes or clarifications
    80â†’- Once approved, your agent will be live on xpander.ai
    81â†’
    82â†’## Questions?
    83â†’
    84â†’Contact us at support@xpander.ai or open an issue in this repository.
    85â†’
    86â†’---
    87â†’

file.content:
# Contributing to xpander.ai Agents Directory

Thank you for your interest in adding your Slack agent to the xpander.ai directory!

## How to Submit Your Agent

### Option 1: Use the Submission Form (Recommended)
Visit [xpander.ai/agents/submit](https://xpander.ai/agents/submit) to submit your agent through our Fillout form.

### Option 2: Submit via GitHub Pull Request
For developers comfortable with Git:

1. **Fork this repository**

2. **Add your logo**
   - Add your agent's logo to `/public/logos/`
   - Logo should be 200x200px PNG or SVG
   - Name it consistently with your agent ID (e.g., `your-agent.png`)

3. **Update agents.json**
   - Edit `/public/api/agents.json`
   - Add your agent entry following the existing format
   - Ensure proper JSON formatting (validate with a JSON linter)

4. **Create a Pull Request**
   - Use the "Add Agent" PR template
   - Fill out all required information
   - Ensure all checklist items are completed

## Agent JSON Schema

```json
{
  "id": "unique-agent-id",
  "name": "Agent Display Name",
  "slug": "url-friendly-slug",
  "shortDescription": "Brief description (max 100 characters)",
  "fullDescription": "Detailed description of your agent's capabilities",
  "author": "Your Name or Company",
  "authorLink": "https://your-website.com",
  "logo": "/logos/your-logo.png",
  "skills": ["Mintlify", "WebSearch", "etc"],
  "capabilities": [
    "Key capability 1",
    "Key capability 2",
    "Key capability 3"
  ],
  "slackInstallUrl": "https://slack.com/oauth/v2/authorize?client_id=YOUR_CLIENT_ID",
  "installCount": "0 installs",
  "createdAt": "2025-01-23T00:00:00Z",
  "a2aUrl": "https://your-domain.com/agent", // Optional
  "a2aSkills": ["skill1", "skill2"] // Optional
}
```

## Guidelines

1. **Quality Standards**
   - Agent must be fully functional
   - Clear, accurate descriptions
   - Professional logo/branding
   - Valid Slack OAuth URL

2. **Content Guidelines**
   - No misleading claims
   - Appropriate for professional use
   - Respects user privacy
   - Follows Slack's terms of service

3. **Technical Requirements**
   - Valid JSON syntax
   - Unique agent ID
   - All required fields populated
   - Logo in correct directory

## Review Process

- PRs are reviewed within 3-5 business days
- We may request changes or clarifications
- Once approved, your agent will be live on xpander.ai

## Questions?

Contact us at support@xpander.ai or open an issue in this repository.

---

By contributing, you agree that your submission complies with our guidelines and that you have the right to distribute the agent information provided.

toolUseResult.originalFile:
# Contributing to xpander.ai Agents Directory

Thank you for your interest in adding your Slack agent to the xpander.ai directory!

## How to Submit Your Agent

### Option 1: Use the Submission Form (Recommended)
Visit [xpander.ai/agents/submit](https://xpander.ai/agents/submit) to submit your agent through our Fillout form.

### Option 2: Submit via GitHub Pull Request
For developers comfortable with Git:

1. **Fork this repository**

2. **Add your logo**
   - Add your agent's logo to `/public/logos/`
   - Logo should be 200x200px PNG or SVG
   - Name it consistently with your agent ID (e.g., `your-agent.png`)

3. **Update agents.json**
   - Edit `/public/api/agents.json`
   - Add your agent entry following the existing format
   - Ensure proper JSON formatting (validate with a JSON linter)

4. **Create a Pull Request**
   - Use the "Add Agent" PR template
   - Fill out all required information
   - Ensure all checklist items are completed

## Agent JSON Schema

```json
{
  "id": "unique-agent-id",
  "name": "Agent Display Name",
  "slug": "url-friendly-slug",
  "shortDescription": "Brief description (max 100 characters)",
  "fullDescription": "Detailed description of your agent's capabilities",
  "author": "Your Name or Company",
  "authorLink": "https://your-website.com",
  "logo": "/logos/your-logo.png",
  "skills": ["Mintlify", "WebSearch", "etc"],
  "capabilities": [
    "Key capability 1",
    "Key capability 2",
    "Key capability 3"
  ],
  "slackInstallUrl": "https://slack.com/oauth/v2/authorize?client_id=YOUR_CLIENT_ID",
  "installCount": "0 installs",
  "createdAt": "2025-01-23T00:00:00Z",
  "a2aUrl": "https://your-domain.com/agent", // Optional
  "a2aSkills": ["skill1", "skill2"] // Optional
}
```

## Guidelines

1. **Quality Standards**
   - Agent must be fully functional
   - Clear, accurate descriptions
   - Professional logo/branding
   - Valid Slack OAuth URL

2. **Content Guidelines**
   - No misleading claims
   - Appropriate for professional use
   - Respects user privacy
   - Follows Slack's terms of service

3. **Technical Requirements**
   - Valid JSON syntax
   - Unique agent ID
   - All required fields populated
   - Logo in correct directory

## Review Process

- PRs are reviewed within 3-5 business days
- We may request changes or clarifications
- Once approved, your agent will be live on xpander.ai

## Questions?

Contact us at support@xpander.ai or open an issue in this repository.

---

By contributing, you agree that your submission complies with our guidelines and that you have the right to distribute the agent information provided.

content.text:
âœ… Fixed issue #1! I've successfully renamed all occurrences of "WebSearch" to "Tavily" in both files:

- **agents.json**: Updated 2 agent entries (browserbase and perplexity) to use "Tavily" instead of "WebSearch" in their skills array
- **CONTRIBUTING.md**: Updated the example JSON schema to show "Tavily" instead of "WebSearch" in the skills field

The changes accurately reflect that Tavily is the actual search service being used.
